name: Sands Beach Resort

reviews.text: Stayed in a two bed beach front apartment, one bedroom (king bed)and full bathroom upstairs and an additional sofa bed outside of the bedroom upstairs, d/s another king bedroom, bathroom, fully equipped kitchen (handy to take cloths/dishwasher tabs/fairy/ice cube bags/tea bags with you all very expensive to buy), and then another sofabed in lounge, tv had euro sports/sky news and a diff film in english every day ie: finding nemo. Each appt has small pation area big enough for bbq, 2 sun lougers (provided) and table for 6 - there is then a path and small wall which divides you from lagoon/beachfront.
reviews.title: Lovely - ignore bad reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No air con - acceptable but disappointing to find they take advantage of this by overcharging on fan rental 70 euros for 2 fans 2 weeks!!! in addition to the 20 euro lounger cushion for 2 weeks!!!
reviews.title: lovely place

reviews.text: Lagoon area is nothing like a stagnant pond as described in a prev review, it is a gently shelving paddling area for the kids, quite tidal but without any strong currents, no good for swimming really for adults and if you do go deeper - which isnt really that deep there are rocks underfoot. Raked everyday, tons of inflatables/buckets spades for all to use left by prev guests - no need to bring with you.
reviews.title: Sands Beach villas is excellent!

reviews.text: Cleaning was excellent - fresh towels everyday, cleaned everyday bar tues/sun, linen changed weekly.
reviews.title: Fab private beach front apartments!

reviews.text: Kids club everyday 10.30-2.30 which is really good, friendly staff - especially suzi, but they wont take any child under 4 - you do have to stay with them if not 4 - which is a shame as other kids cliubs will take from 3. Adult activities are also every morn/pm incl footy/volleyball/billiards all the usual and good fun if bored of sun bathing.
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.liked: — the amount of pools, it meant you never felt crowded

reviews.text: Travelling as a family of 4 (2ad 2chd) stayed at Sands Beach Resort having read a number of reviews (22 - 29 May 08). Booked hotel via Lastminute which was a good deal but also contacted the hotel direct to advise of special request, this is def worth doing as we got what we asked for.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: Got taxi from airport to hotel costing 20 euros and taking about 15 mins. Check-in was easy and quick. Villa was more spacious than we expected with the surrounding areas being clean. Facilities within the villa was okay although there was a need to refurb the bathroom and some furnishings as they had seen better days. The kitchen had a good size fridge/freezer, dishwasher, toaster, kettle, microwave and a selection of dishes which was good as we went SC. There are a number of cats on the complex and can be annoying as they will follow people if encouraged.
reviews.title: Just as i expected

reviews.text: As stated in other reviews the swimming pools were cold not that it stopped my kids jumping in! All pools were good sizes in each block and sadly there was not enough sun loungers in the area. The private beach was disappointing and a place we spent no time as the public area beach was far better and cleaner.
reviews.title: great place
3 star MAX
reviews.text: WIND, yes this is def blowing! Like others I read about the wind but didn't realise how much. A thin jumper/cardy is worth taking in the evenings as does get chilly. It is true that further into town you go there's less wind and think this might be due to the Sands Beach being located at the far end penninsular (without getting too techy!!).

reviews.title: Sands Beach - Excellent
reviews.text: Evening entertainment was hit-miss. The Drag Queen show was very funny as was the reps attempt to reproduce Starlight Express on skates with one rep not being too good on her skates. Every evening had a kids disco and meet the 6ft dog! If you go into show with a sense of humour you'll enjoy!

What a disappointment Sands Beach Resort was. The overall appearance of the outdoor areas is nice, clean, comfortable. However, the villas are less than acceptable. Could have cried when I saw our accommodation. The bathroom was horrible with rust around the bath. The fridge/freezer in the kitchen area was disgusting. There needs to investment made to upgrade these villas to 2008 standards. Wouldn't go back to this resort and it doesn't deserve to be a 4 star resort. I would rate it as between a very good 2 star and a bad 3 star.
reviews.title: disappointed

reviews.text: We stayed at this resort from 29th June till July 12th, in villa Playa del Sol no 34.
reviews.title: Absolutely great

reviews.text: One word....... FANTASTIC. Please ignore the bad reviews as they were totally unfounded and probably made by very fussy people looking for bad things to say about this resort. We were there with my in-laws, my wife and 3 kids ages 3, 5, and 12. we all had a blast with loads of stuff to do. If you want a relaxing yet active holiday this is the place to go. Choose from a variety of organised activities such as.... sailing, football, shooting, water-polo, tennis and much more to keep the calories burning. At nights there were various entertainments for youg and old.
reviews.title: not for us

reviews.text: I found the staff very friendly, helpfull, and courteous to our needs.
reviews.title: Stunning Resort!
not too sure!!
reviews.text: If I had a bad thing to say about our visit it would be the inflated prices in the supermarkets... which totally had nothing to do with the resort.

Just back from a week at the Sands Beach Villas - stayed in a one bedroom apartment with pool view (Plaza Amarilla). The villas themselves were well decorated and had good facilities. The things we liked about the resort were that we were travelling with a 2 and 4 year old and rooms were great for using the pool and lagoon beach - everything within a few steps away so never a need to pack a bag to go anywhere. We found it relaxing that the kids could go out to the pool area and one of us sit by the side and the other lie on a sun bed at the villas terrace - with the doors always being open for the kids to come in and out. The pools were great for little ones as there was a toodler pool and larger pool with a gentle slop in. The weather was good although very windy.
reviews.title: Liked the villas

likes.liked: — The facilities and proximity to the pools

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The negative side was that the food was awful in the hotel's main restaurant (we were on half board) - the kids really ate nothing but chips and fruit all week! The pools were freezing - not heated - although the main pool by the Mai Tai restaurant was supposed to be heated but I couldn't tell the difference. The resort itself had nothing to offer but tacky shops and cheap restaurants - although there is a Melia hotel nearby that did good food but v. expensive.
reviews.title: Fantastic... Already decided to Return

likes.liked: — Spaciousness, cleanliness and originality of villa.
likes.disliked: — Due to facing onto the pool, the rear window faced over a car park.

reviews.text: Great for a reasonably cheap week away with young children but go when it's really hot and the pools have warmed up! Also eat out and get things stocked up in the fridge to eat breakfast in.
reviews.title: Lovely time had by all

reviews.text: We booked this holiday via a cancellation website. There weren't many recent reviews when we booked it so went purely on the pictures provided of the accomodation.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

likes.liked: — very well equipped. Clean and modern

reviews.text: We travelled on 3rd April 2008 for a weeks break before our baby is due in June. The weather was fantastic, lovely and sunny in the day but with a slight breeze so this made it very comfortable and easy to sit in the sun all day. The evenings were warm, but sometimes needed long sleeves depending how late and how near the sea you were eating.
reviews.title: Pitty about door falling on me and thin sheets

likes.liked: — Location close to beaches - and pools great
likes.disliked: — door falling off and poor sheets /towels

description: Sands Beach Resort lies on the eastern coast of Lanzarote, 15 min from the airport, facing Los Charcos Beach and with direct access to the promenade. The Resort is provided of its own beach, 13 swimming pools (7 adults and 6 paddling), restaurants, pub, supermarket, gym, health center, internet, 24h reception, parking, tennis court, entertainment, etc. The apartments are very spacious and comfortable, with safe, tv-sat, microwave, fridge and freezer, oven, dishwasher, hairdryer, etc.
